column4: User Query
column5: Chatbot Response

column4: My luggage didn’t arrive. What should I do?
column5: Please visit the Lost & Found counter near Belt 3 in the arrival hall. The staff will register a report and help trace your baggage through your airline’s tracking system.

column4: Where is the Lost and Found desk located?
column5: It’s located beside Belt 2 in the international arrivals area at Islamabad Airport, next to the Customs exit. Look for the blue “Lost & Found” signage.

column4: I lost my passport on the plane. Whom should I contact?
column5: Immediately visit your airline’s arrival counter or the Lost & Found office. Airport security will assist in coordinating with the airline to retrieve it.

column4: Is there a Lost and Found office at Islamabad Airport?
column5: Yes, it operates 24/7 beside the customs area in the arrivals terminal. The staff handles lost baggage, travel documents, and personal items.

column4: How can I report my missing bag?
column5: Go to the airline’s baggage claim counter or Lost & Found section, provide your baggage tag and flight number, and fill out a missing baggage form.

column4: My suitcase is damaged. Can I file a complaint?
column5: Yes, report damaged baggage at your airline’s claim counter before leaving the hall. Airlines usually inspect and log the damage immediately.

column4: I found someone’s bag. Where should I return it?
column5: Hand it over to airport security or directly to the Lost & Found counter. Please don’t open it — staff will record it and contact the rightful owner.

column4: How long does it take to recover lost luggage?
column5: It usually takes 24–48 hours, depending on airline tracing and connecting flights. The staff will contact you as soon as your baggage arrives.

column4: What are the Lost & Found office hours?
column5: The office is open round-the-clock to help passengers from both domestic and international flights. You can visit anytime after landing.

column4: Is there a helpline number for missing items?
column5: Yes, you can call +92-51-111-786-787 or email lostfound@islamabadairport.com for quick assistance. Keep your flight details ready.

column4: I lost my wallet near immigration. What should I do?
column5: Report it immediately to the airport security desk or Lost & Found office. They will check CCTV and coordinate with cleaning staff.

column4: Can I email about my missing luggage?
column5: Yes, email your flight number, description, and contact details to lostfound@islamabadairport.com. You’ll get a tracking reference within 24 hours.

column4: My bag didn’t arrive from Dubai. Who will help me?
column5: Report it at your airline’s arrival desk. They will coordinate with the Dubai ground staff and the Lost & Found team here to trace it.

column4: What documents do I need to claim my lost item?
column5: You’ll need your passport or CNIC and any proof of ownership like baggage tags or purchase receipts.

column4: I left my phone in the restroom. What should I do?
column5: Visit the Lost & Found counter and provide the restroom location and time. If found, staff will verify ownership and return it.

column4: Can someone else collect my lost item for me?
column5: Yes, another person can collect it with your written authorization and a copy of both IDs.

column4: Is there CCTV coverage in the baggage area?
column5: Yes, all belts and surrounding areas are under 24/7 CCTV surveillance. Footage can be reviewed by authorized staff upon request.

column4: How long are lost items kept at the airport?
column5: Unclaimed items are stored safely for 90 days in the Lost & Found storage area, after which they are handed to authorities.

column4: I found a passport at the waiting area. What do I do?
column5: Please hand it to the immigration counter or Lost & Found staff. They handle sensitive documents with priority.

column4: My baggage tag is missing. Can my bag still be traced?
column5: Yes, if you provide flight details, name, and bag description, staff can track it through the airline database.

column4: Is there a separate Lost & Found for domestic flights?
column5: Yes, domestic arrivals have a separate desk near Belt 1 for passengers of PIA, Airblue, and Serene Air.

column4: I lost my gold jewelry. Is there a way to recover it?
column5: Report it immediately to Lost & Found. Valuable items like jewelry are logged, sealed, and stored under supervision.

column4: Can I check online if my item has been found?
column5: Currently, online lookup isn’t active, but the helpline can confirm by checking the item list manually.

column4: What happens if nobody claims a lost item?
column5: It’s stored for 90 days and then transferred to airport authorities for disposal or donation.

column4: My child’s stroller didn’t come with our luggage.
column5: Report it at the baggage desk; strollers sometimes come on later flights or through special handling.

column4: Who manages Lost & Found at Islamabad Airport?
column5: The Airport Facilitation Department (AFD) manages the Lost & Found service under airport operations.

column4: Can I get compensation for my lost baggage?
column5: Compensation policies vary by airline. File a Property Irregularity Report (PIR) to initiate a claim.

column4: How do I identify my bag if it’s found?
column5: Describe color, size, brand, and any labels or stickers. Staff match it with stored items before release.

column4: Is there any fee for claiming a lost item?
column5: No, Lost & Found services are free for all passengers at Islamabad International Airport.

column4: Can I get help if I lost something in the taxi area?
column5: Yes, report it to the airport police post at the arrival exit, or visit Lost & Found for coordination.

column4: I lost my smartwatch during arrival. Can it be tracked?
column5: Smart devices are logged with serial numbers. If found, staff can identify it and contact you.

column4: I found a mobile phone near baggage claim. What should I do?
column5: Submit it at the Lost & Found desk. Staff record its IMEI and store it securely.

column4: My baggage arrived late. Will it be delivered to my home?
column5: Many airlines offer home delivery for delayed bags within Islamabad and Rawalpindi. Confirm at your airline desk.

column4: I forgot my laptop on the plane.
column5: Contact your airline immediately; the crew or ground staff will retrieve it if found.

column4: Is the Lost and Found office inside or outside arrivals?
column5: It’s located inside the arrivals hall, next to the customs clearance area.

column4: Can I call to check the status of my report?
column5: Yes, call the helpline with your case number. Staff will update you on progress.

column4: I lost a gold ring yesterday. Is it possible it’s found?
column5: If found, it will be in secure storage. Bring your ID to check with the Lost & Found supervisor.

column4: My luggage lock is broken. Whom should I report to?
column5: Inform your airline’s baggage claim counter; they handle damage reports on arrival.

column4: Can I claim another person’s item with permission?
column5: Yes, with an authorization letter, ID copies, and item details.

column4: What if my bag looks similar to someone else’s?
column5: Confirm the baggage tag before leaving. Staff can assist with verification.

column4: I forgot my jacket on the conveyor belt.
column5: Go to Lost & Found with your flight number and time; such items are usually logged quickly.

column4: Are lost items checked daily?
column5: Yes, all found items are cataloged and verified every 12 hours by the Lost & Found team.

column4: I left a file in the waiting area. Can I get it back?
column5: Visit the Lost & Found office; files and documents are kept in the secure section.

column4: Is there a WhatsApp number for Lost & Found?
column5: Not yet, but the team can be reached by phone or email anytime.

column4: Can I send someone to pick my lost bag tomorrow?
column5: Yes, with an authorization letter and CNIC copy of both individuals.

column4: I left my book on a trolley.
column5: Check at Lost & Found; small items are collected from trolleys daily.

column4: Can I track my complaint online?
column5: Tracking is currently manual; call with your case reference for updates.

column4: How soon should I report missing baggage?
column5: Immediately after noticing the loss. Quick reporting increases recovery chances.

column4: What if my bag was mistakenly taken by someone else?
column5: Lost & Found reviews CCTV footage and contacts passengers through airline data.

column4: I lost my identity card at the airport.
column5: Report it at the Lost & Found and local police helpdesk for documentation.

column4: My bag arrived torn and missing items.
column5: Please report it immediately to your airline’s claim counter. They’ll inspect the damage and initiate a compensation or replacement procedure.

column4: I lost my CNIC while exiting the terminal.
column5: Visit the Lost & Found desk and report it. They maintain a list of found documents and coordinate with airport security.

column4: How can I know if my bag was sent on another flight?
column5: The airline can trace it through the baggage tag number. Lost & Found will update you once it arrives.

column4: I lost my suitcase lock keys. Can airport staff help?
column5: For security reasons, staff can’t break locks, but airline maintenance can assist with verification and unlocking if needed.

column4: My luggage came wet or soaked. What can I do?
column5: Report it to your airline within the arrival area. They’ll note the condition and offer assistance for damaged contents.

column4: Can I claim insurance for lost baggage?
column5: Yes, if you purchased travel insurance, file your claim using the Lost & Found report and airline documentation.

column4: I lost my baggage receipt tag. How can I identify my luggage?
column5: Describe the bag’s color, brand, and any marks. Staff can verify ownership through your flight details.

column4: My luggage came late but without a tag. What to do?
column5: Report it to the Lost & Found section. They’ll check the tagless baggage list and confirm via airline data.

column4: Can I report lost luggage after leaving the airport?
column5: Yes, you can email or call the Lost & Found office within 24 hours with your flight and contact information.

column4: How do I know if someone submitted my lost item?
column5: The Lost & Found staff match reports daily and will contact you through the number provided in your complaint.

column4: What if my bag was mistakenly checked to another destination?
column5: The airline will reroute it to Islamabad. You’ll be contacted once it arrives.

column4: Can I get a written confirmation for my lost item report?
column5: Yes, you’ll receive a printed acknowledgment with your case reference number for future tracking.

column4: My luggage was delayed by a day. Will I be informed?
column5: Once your baggage arrives, Lost & Found will notify you through SMS or phone call.

column4: I forgot a baby bag on the seat in arrivals.
column5: Visit Lost & Found immediately. Such items are logged quickly and stored separately for easy retrieval.

column4: My luggage handle broke during transit.
column5: Report it to your airline before leaving. Airlines often provide repair or reimbursement options.

column4: Can Lost & Found share CCTV footage with me?
column5: CCTV footage can be viewed only by authorized personnel upon written request or police involvement.

column4: I found someone’s passport. Can I hand it to the airline?
column5: You may, but the recommended step is to submit it to the Lost & Found or immigration desk for secure handling.

column4: I lost my glasses near the exit area.
column5: Check with the Lost & Found desk; small personal items like glasses are usually turned in by cleaning staff.

column4: What if my baggage was sent to another city?
column5: The airline and Lost & Found team will coordinate to forward it to Islamabad and notify you.

column4: How can I prove an item belongs to me?
column5: Provide detailed description, photos if available, and ID verification.

column4: My bag is found but zipper broken. Will it be replaced?
column5: Airlines usually repair or compensate for minor damage if reported before leaving arrivals.

column4: How do I follow up on my lost luggage report?
column5: Call the Lost & Found helpline and mention your case number for updates.

column4: Can I register multiple lost items together?
column5: Yes, list all items in one report and describe each clearly.

column4: What if my missing bag arrived damaged?
column5: File a joint “damage and delay” report at the airline counter.

column4: I forgot my shopping bag in the waiting lounge.
column5: Lost & Found staff collect unattended items from the lounge every 2 hours.

column4: How long will Lost & Found store my item?
column5: Lost items are securely stored for up to 90 days before being handed over to authorities.

column4: My earphones are missing from my bag.
column5: Report theft suspicion immediately; security will assist with investigation.

column4: I left my car keys in the baggage trolley.
column5: Go to the Lost & Found counter; trolley cleaning staff regularly turn in found keys.

column4: Can I collect my lost item after a few days?
column5: Yes, bring your ID and report number; the office will release it after verification.

column4: I lost my boarding pass after landing.
column5: Visit the airline counter; they can reissue or confirm your travel details.

column4: My baggage is missing from Belt 4.
column5: Wait till the belt stops, then report to your airline’s counter or Lost & Found with your baggage tag.

column4: I lost my bag two days ago. Can I still get it back?
column5: Yes, if found, it’ll be in Lost & Found storage. Bring ID for collection.

column4: Who can I contact for lost duty-free items?
column5: Duty-free staff maintain a separate record; Lost & Found can assist in coordination.

column4: Can I report lost luggage through WhatsApp?
column5: Not at this time. Please use the helpline or email system.

column4: I found a jewelry box in arrivals.
column5: Kindly submit it at Lost & Found. Valuable items are kept under sealed storage.

column4: My luggage arrived with a broken wheel.
column5: Report it immediately; airlines may offer compensation or repair vouchers.

column4: How do I know if my complaint is registered?
column5: The staff will issue you a complaint number printed on the acknowledgment slip.

column4: I forgot a toy bag near Belt 1.
column5: Inform Lost & Found; such items are logged under the “family belongings” category.

column4: How can I contact my airline’s baggage desk?
column5: The Lost & Found office has airline contact extensions for direct assistance.

column4: I lost my bag’s handle cover.
column5: It’s considered a personal item; check Lost & Found’s small items log.

column4: My item was found but someone else claimed it.
column5: Ownership disputes are resolved through ID and proof verification.

column4: Is there a separate section for electronic items?
column5: Yes, phones, tablets, and laptops are stored in the “High-Value Items” area.

column4: Can I send my driver to collect my bag?
column5: Yes, with a signed authorization and both CNIC copies.

column4: I lost my credit card in the terminal.
column5: Immediately block it and report at Lost & Found for recovery.

column4: My suitcase looks tampered with.
column5: Do not open it in public; inform airline staff for inspection and report.

column4: Is there any penalty for lost trolleys?
column5: Trolleys are managed by the airport; lost tokens may have a small replacement fee.

column4: My bag came with another passenger’s tag.
column5: Inform Lost & Found immediately to correct the record and avoid confusion.

column4: Can I collect my item outside working hours?
column5: The Lost & Found operates 24/7, so you can collect it anytime.

column4: Is there a waiting time to file a report?
column5: Usually 5–10 minutes depending on passenger volume.

column4: I lost a charger in the arrival lounge.
column5: Report it; small electronics are tagged and stored for up to 30 days.

column4: Can I get CCTV proof for my missing bag?
column5: Only law enforcement or authorized staff can access footage upon your request.

column4: I forgot my handbag at the prayer area.
column5: Please visit the Lost & Found counter near Belt 3. Prayer area items are regularly collected and logged by cleaning staff.

column4: Can I collect my lost luggage after 10 PM?
column5: Yes, the Lost & Found office operates 24 hours a day. You can collect your luggage anytime with proper ID.

column4: I lost my smartwatch charger on the plane.
column5: Inform your airline desk immediately; crew may recover it during post-flight cleaning.

column4: What if my baggage was swapped with another passenger’s?
column5: Report it to the Lost & Found team. They will trace the other passenger through the airline system and assist in the exchange.

column4: My item is valuable. How can I ensure it’s safely stored?
column5: High-value items like jewelry and electronics are sealed and stored in a separate secure cabinet under camera supervision.

column4: I forgot my neck pillow near immigration.
column5: Check at the Lost & Found; small comfort items are often found and logged by airport housekeeping.

column4: Can I get a copy of the complaint I filed?
column5: Yes, a printed or emailed copy can be provided on request with your case reference.

column4: I found a boarding pass on the floor. What should I do?
column5: Submit it to the Lost & Found desk; unclaimed documents are stored for 30 days.

column4: My luggage zipper is broken and items are missing.
column5: Report both damage and missing item to your airline counter immediately for compensation claim.

column4: Can I track my missing luggage through my airline app?
column5: Some airlines provide real-time baggage tracking; confirm at your airline counter for details.

column4: I lost my bag 3 days ago and haven’t heard back.
column5: Follow up by calling the Lost & Found helpline with your case number for an update.

column4: How will I know if my bag is found?
column5: You’ll receive a call or email once your bag arrives. Always ensure your contact info is accurate on the report.

column4: I found a baby bottle near baggage area.
column5: Kindly hand it to Lost & Found staff; such items are kept in a separate hygiene-safe section.

column4: My perfume bottles leaked inside my bag.
column5: Report it to your airline’s desk. Liquids are subject to transport conditions and may not be compensated.

column4: Can I use the Lost & Found service if I’m not a passenger?
column5: Only passengers or their authorized representatives with valid documents can access it.

column4: My luggage came with tape marks as if opened.
column5: Report it before leaving the terminal; security will verify handling history.

column4: I forgot my medical bag on Belt 2.
column5: Go to Lost & Found immediately; essential medication is prioritized for return.

column4: Can I call to ask about found items before visiting?
column5: Yes, call +92-51-111-786-787 and mention the date, flight, and item details for confirmation.

column4: What if I lost my luggage tag and forgot the flight number?
column5: The staff can trace it through your passport, airline, and approximate time of arrival.

column4: I left my wristwatch in the washroom.
column5: Lost & Found regularly collects such items from restrooms. Please provide the location and time.

column4: I left my food container at the baggage area.
column5: Perishable items are not stored, but you can confirm with Lost & Found if it was handed in.

column4: My baby stroller was damaged.
column5: Inform your airline’s arrival counter immediately; airlines handle stroller compensation separately.

column4: Can I contact Lost & Found on social media?
column5: Currently, only phone and email contact is supported for security reasons.

column4: I forgot my jacket in the arrival bus.
column5: Report it to the Lost & Found desk; shuttle service items are logged by bus attendants.

column4: Can I get a copy of CCTV recording for my missing bag?
column5: Only law enforcement can access CCTV footage upon a written complaint.

column4: I lost my charger cable in the seating area.
column5: Go to Lost & Found; charging cables are among the most commonly found items.

column4: My luggage color is similar to others. How to avoid confusion next time?
column5: Attach bright ribbons or tags before check-in to identify your bag easily.

column4: I lost my prayer mat in the terminal.
column5: Visit Lost & Found; items from prayer areas are collected daily.

column4: Can Lost & Found send my item through courier?
column5: Currently, only in-person collection or authorized representative pickup is allowed.

column4: My wallet was returned but money missing.
column5: Report immediately to airport security for investigation.

column4: Can I retrieve my lost SIM card from Lost & Found?
column5: Yes, if turned in, but ownership verification is required through CNIC or SIM registration.

column4: My small handbag is missing. What should I do first?
column5: Stay calm and visit Lost & Found before leaving the terminal. Provide color, brand, and contents for quick matching.

column4: I found a USB drive in the lounge.
column5: Submit it to Lost & Found. Found electronics are sealed for privacy protection.

column4: How long does it take for found items to be listed?
column5: Usually within 12 hours after collection and logging by staff.

column4: I lost my umbrella near the arrival exit.
column5: Check Lost & Found; umbrellas are placed in the “General Items” section.

column4: Can I authorize my friend to check for my item?
column5: Yes, but only with a signed authorization letter and valid IDs.

column4: My luggage was delayed and arrived next day. Do I still report it?
column5: Yes, to ensure it’s properly logged and confirmed as delivered.

column4: I lost my student ID card.
column5: Check at Lost & Found; such cards are stored for 30 days before being sent to issuing institutions.

column4: What should I do if I find someone’s watch?
column5: Hand it to Lost & Found staff; they’ll record its brand, color, and location found.

column4: I lost my medical prescription file.
column5: Such documents are handled carefully and stored in the document section of Lost & Found.

column4: My luggage had fragile stickers but is broken.
column5: Report it to the airline; fragile items are covered under their handling policy.

column4: Can I get an update via SMS for my case?
column5: Yes, if you provided your phone number in the complaint form.

column4: I left my face mask box on a trolley.
column5: It may not be stored, but confirm at Lost & Found if found by staff.

column4: My bag’s combination lock is jammed.
column5: Airline staff can assist in unlocking after ownership verification.

column4: Can I access the Lost & Found storage area myself?
column5: No, only authorized staff have access for security and privacy reasons.

column4: I lost my shopping bag from Duty Free.
column5: Report at Lost & Found; they coordinate directly with Duty Free management.

column4: What happens to unclaimed cash found at the airport?
column5: It’s deposited with airport authorities after verification and record entry.

column4: I forgot my travel pillow on the luggage trolley.
column5: Visit Lost & Found; such comfort items are commonly turned in.

column4: I lost my ring near the arrival escalator.
column5: Inform Lost & Found; cleaning teams often recover jewelry during shift checks.
